text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: Do not be wise in words—be wise in deeds.
author: Jewish Proverb

text: In seeking wisdom, you are a wise man; in imagining you have attained it, you are a fool.
author: Lord Chesterfield

text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

text: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Knowledge is knowing what to say. Wisdom is knowing when to say it.
author: Unknown

text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: St. Augustine

text: Common sense is wisdom with its sleeves rolled up.
author: Kyle Chandler

text: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you’d have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

text: Wise men learn more from fools than fools from the wise.
author: Cato the Elder

text: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: He who opens a school door closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

text: An intelligent person aims at wisdom, but a fool starts off in many directions.
author: Proverbs 17:24

text: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

text: Discipline is wisdom and vice versa.
author: M. Scott Peck

text: The wise adapt themselves to circumstances, as water molds itself to the pitcher.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
author: Sophocles

text: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca

text: Wisdom is the daughter of experience.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Do not correct a fool, or he will hate you; correct a wise man, and he will appreciate you.
author: Proverbs 9:8
